entry.title: Lawsuit embroiled Machi Big Brother has lost over $10M in NFTs
PEPE Enjoys Sharp 64% Rally, But Will This Rise Last?
entry.summary:
PEPE has observed a sharp increase of around 64% during the past few days, but is this rise here to stay? Here’s what on-chain data suggests.
PEPE Whale Transfers And Volume Have Been High Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, whales have actively engaged with the asset as it has gone up during the last few days. The relevant indicator here is the “whale transaction count,” which measures all PEPE transfers taking place on the blockchain that are worth at least $100,000 in value.
This indicator can provide us with hints about how active the whales are in the market currently, as generally, they are the only investors capable of moving such a large amount of the asset with a single transfer.
For top cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, the cutoff for whale…

entry.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Advocates for Bitcoin and Opposes CBDCs in Candid Interview
entry.summary:
U.S. presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. spoke in an interview with the New York Post on June 22, 2023, and discussed a wide range of topics, including vaccines and bitcoin. Kennedy stated that if he becomes president, he will ensure that the U.S. maintains “policies that support bitcoin and the freedom to transact.”
RFK Jr. Blasts Mainstream Media Insisting He’s ‘Never Been Anti-Vaccine’
On Thursday, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the son of former U.S. attorney general and senator Robert F. Kennedy and the nephew of former U.S. president John F. Kennedy, discussed a few specific topics with Lydia Moynihan of the New York Post. Kennedy has recently garnered attention following a challenge from podcaster Joe Rogan to Houston-based scientist Peter Hotez for a vaccine debate with Kenned…

entry.title: Blockchain Technology: Revolutionizing Industries Beyond Finance
entry.summary:
Blockchain technology, which is most usually linked with cryptocurrencies, has emerged as a transformational force that goes far beyond banking. Blockchain has the potential to change a variety of industries, including healthcare, supply chain management, and voting systems, due to its decentralized and transparent nature. In this article, we will look at how blockchain technology is altering various industries, opening up new avenues for efficiency, transparency, and trust. Blockchain Technology in Healthcare The incorporation of blockchain technology has the potential to dramatically enhance the healthcare business. Here's how it's done:
Secure Data Management: By offering a secure and immutable ledger for healthcare records, blockchain has the potential to tran…

entry.title: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs): Transforming the Future of Money in 2023
entry.summary: In an era of tremendous technology breakthroughs, the world of banking is about to undergo a significant transformation. Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) have emerged as a game-changing invention with enormous potential to shape the future of money. CBDCs are poised to transform the way we transact, store value, and interact with the financial system as digital representations of a country's legal currency. In this article, we will look into CBDCs and their potential implications for the future of money. CBDCs: An Introduction CBDCs are digital currencies created and regulated by central banks that serve as a digital representation of a country's fiat currency. CBDCs, as opposed to decentralized cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum, are totally centra…

entry.title: The Growth of Stablecoins: Providing Stability Within the Crypto Market
entry.summary: The world of cryptocurrencies has seen a substantial increase in popularity and adoption in recent years. As this digital ecosystem grows, one sort of cryptocurrency has emerged as a significant participant in providing stability in the unpredictable cryptocurrency market: stablecoins. Stablecoins have gained traction as a safe alternative, bringing stability to investors and users alike, thanks to their unique architecture and intrinsic properties. In this article, we will look at the rise of stablecoins and their critical role in giving stability to the crypto market. Stablecoins Explained Stablecoins are a type of cryptocurrency that is intended to reduce the inherent volatility of traditional cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. Stablecoins, as oppose…

entry.title: BlackRock Foresees Long Road To Institutional DeFi Adoption Amid Regulatory Uncertainty
entry.summary:
In the rapidly evolving world of crypto, the concept of Decentralized Finance (DeFi) has been gaining substantial attention. While it holds the potential to revolutionize the traditional financial system, its integration into the mainstream finance world may be a distant reality, according to BlackRock Inc, the world’s largest asset manager.
During the recent State of Crypto Summit, hosted by Coinbase Global Inc in partnership with the Financial Times, BlackRock’s Head of Strategic Partnerships, Joseph Chalom, discussed the prospects and challenges related to DeFi from an institutional investor’s perspective.
Regulatory Hurdles Slow Institutional DeFi Adoption
DeFi, a cornerstone of the crypto sphere where trades are executed automatically on the blockchain via computer codes, has be…

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Stays Above $30,000, Despite Traders Moving to Secure Recent Gains
entry.summary:
Bitcoin consolidated around the $30,000 level on Friday, as traders attempted to maintain bullish sentiment following recent gains. The world’s largest cryptocurrency briefly dropped below this point earlier in the day, before bulls swept in to buy the dip in price. However, ethereum fell below a recent high above $1,900.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin remained above the $30,000 level on Friday, as traders attempted to keep sentiment bullish heading into the weekend.
Following a low of $29,679.16 earlier in the day, BTC/USD moved to a peak of $30,334.40 as the day progressed.
Price has since gone on to fall from its previous high, as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) encountered a point of resistance.
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
At the time of writing, the index is tracking …

entry.title: Japan’s Largest Bank MUFG To Introduce Stablecoins Anchored To Global Currencies
entry.summary:
One of Japan’s most prominent banks, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), has announced its intention to issue global stablecoins linked to various foreign currencies, notably the United States dollar. To accomplish this, the financial powerhouse will utilize its Progmat platform for minting these coins.
Since the beginning of June, Japan has implemented a new law, allowing licensed banks, trust companies, and registered money transfer agents in the country to legally issue these cryptocurrencies. By establishing itself as a global hub for stablecoin issuance, Japan has positioned itself to support the expansion of decentralized internet and web3 companies.
This strategic move is expected to open up lucrative opportunities within the digital realm, allowing the nation to explore and …

entry.title: Future-Proof Inheritance: Why Bitcoin Holds The Keys To My Will
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Konstantin Rabin, a finance and technology writer. Death is not something that many people like talking about all too much, but it is crucial to sit and have a good think about what will happen to all of your earthly belongings when the inevitable eventually happens. Despite its importance, a 2021 study found that less than half of all adults in the U.S. have a will set up at all. While many are too scared of thinking about it, a large number of people simply feel that they lack the know-how for setting one up or want to wait until they have children before they feel the need to sort out their afterlives. Over the last year or so, I decided to have this “will” discussion with myself, and after much thinking and many hours of research, the answer for the bes…

entry.title: Fed Chair Powell Makes Subtle Nod To Ripple, Coincidence Or Not?
entry.summary:
A rumor is currently circulating on Twitter about an alleged connection between Ripple Labs and the US Federal Reserve (Fed). Even though the story is apparently very far-fetched, it is nevertheless a story worth telling, and we don’t want to keep it quiet.
The origin of the rumor is popular XRP army member @NFAdotcrypto. The user shared a video clip from Fed chairman Jerome Powell’s semi-annual testimony before the US Congress yesterday. Congressman Wiley Nickel asks the Fed chairman how he liked the recent concert by the Grateful Dead, an American rock band founded in 1965.
Powell replied that he had been a “Grateful Dead fan” for 50 years, whereupon Congressman Wiley Nickel replied, “I found a universal truth, I like people who like the Grateful Dead.” And here comes the connection …

entry.title: Lawyer Seeks Reopening of Onecoin Case in Bulgaria, Seizure of Assets
entry.summary:
A lawyer representing Onecoin victims has urged Bulgarian authorities to reopen an investigation into the crypto pyramid scheme and seize assets to compensate his clients. The attorney is asking officials in Sofia to take into account developments he considers related to the case, including the recent murder of a Bulgarian crime figure in South Africa.
Attorney Hopes New Bulgarian Chief Prosecutor Takes on Onecoin Investigation
Dr. Jonathan Levy, a legal representative for people affected by Onecoin from several countries, has filed a new request that Bulgaria’s acting top prosecutor reopens an investigation into the multi-billion dollar crypto Ponzi scheme and seize associated assets for restitution of the victims.
In a letter to the Bulgarian Ministry of Justice, Levy is turning a…

entry.title: Japan’s Largest Bank to Support Global Stablecoin Issuance
entry.summary: Top Japanese banking group Mitsubishi UFJ (MUFG) is reportedly holding discussions with stablecoin issuers to have them issue such tokens on the group's blockchain platform. MUFG is also engaging entertainment companies and non-financial businesses on stablecoin projects. The announcement is in conjunction with the implementation of Japan's stablecoin law on June 1. The law enabled the country's licensed financial institutions and registered money transfer agencies to issue stablecoins. However, it only allowed for the issuance and use of such tokens that are fully backed by fiat currencies. Japan Eases Laws on Stablecoins Speaking in an interview with Bloomberg, MUFG's vice president of product, Tatsuya Saito, said the group was engaging multiple parties to have them…

entry.title: Securing Web3 With Zero Trust: Empowering Data, Smart Contracts, and AI on the Blockchain With Mind Network
entry.summary: In the rapidly evolving world of Web3, where data security and privacy are paramount, innovative solutions are needed to protect sensitive information and establish trust within the decentralized ecosystem. This sponsored article delves into the concept of Zero Trust and explores how it serves as the foundation for a revolutionary platform called Mind Network. By combining the principles of Zero Trust with cutting-edge encryption techniques, Mind Network aims to empower users, developers, and businesses to secure their data, smart contracts, and AI models on the blockchain. Mind Network recently closed its seed round fundraising, led by Binance Labs and co-invested by SevenX Ventures, HashKey Capital, Arweave SCP Ventures, etc. Mind Network was incubated by Binance Incubation Camp Season 5…

entry.title: IMF Acknowledges Ineffectiveness of Banning Cryptocurrencies, Encourages CBDC Adoption
entry.summary:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has recognized that banning cryptocurrencies may not be an effective long-term strategy. Instead, the focus should be on meeting digital payment needs and improving transparency in the use of these digital assets.
This acknowledgment comes as Latin American and Caribbean (LAC) countries lead the way in adopting digital money solutions, with several nations exploring Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) to foster financial inclusion and address currency substitution concerns.
The comment was made in a post promoting Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) in the Latin America and Caribbean (LAC) regions. It stated that LAC countries are “at the forefront of digital money adoption,” then delineating the term digital money into CBDCs and crypto as…

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents—and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.

entry.summary: CCO and co-founder of Collab.Land Anjali Young explained at this year’s NFC Lisbon the origins of the crypto community tool kit, which industry niches are turning to its suite of products, and what’s next for the project since its token distribution event last February.

entry.title: Buying a Slice of H.R. Giger's 'Alien' Is Fine Art, Not Memorabilia: Particle CEO
entry.summary: With H.R. Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.

entry.title: Community Co-Creation 'Is a Big Step for Fashion Brands' Entering the Metaverse: BNV Founder and CEO
entry.summary: The founder and CEO of metaverse fashion platform BNV Richard Hobbs said big brands are still nervous to let fans and community members customize their favorite garments. Still, he believes that as long as you can meet a firm's commercial bottom lines while stirring engagement, there's nothing to lose.

entry.title: Standard Crypto VC Co-Founder on NFTs and Their Stigma in Gaming
entry.summary: Alok Vasudev is a co-founder of venture capital firm Standard Crypto. In an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, he shares his thoughts on NFT marketing, NFT utility in gaming, and the stigma that pervades the industry.

entry.title: Ava Labs Announces Avalanche Arcad3 for Game Developers at 3XP
entry.summary: Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang shares news with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the crypto firm's latest push to help traditional game developers break into blockchain gaming.

entry.title: ‘Like a Middle Finger to Western Culture’: YuYu Unpacks Inspiration Behind NFT Expo GAG
entry.summary: At this year’s NFC Lisbon, multimedia artist and photographer YuLiang "YuYu" Liu broke down how themes from traditional painting and BDSM informed his latest NFT exhibition called “GAG.” He also shared exclusively with Decrypt a yet-to-be-launched drop for fans of his work.

entry.title: 'Competition Was Rather Low' in Mobile Wallet Space, Says Zerion Head of Growth
entry.summary: Zerion's move to launch a mobile-first crypto wallet not only helped NFT users swap jpegs on the go but was also a play to get away from crypto's desktop-centric user experience. And with such little competition, Zerion's head of growth Alexander Guy told Decrypt at NFC Lisbon it's managed to rake in 150,000 funded wallets. Next step? Taking on MetaMask and contending as a browser-extension wallet.

entry.title: ‘We’ve Never Seen Anything Like This in VR’, Says The Sandbox COO on Apple’s Vision Pro Headset
entry.summary: The Sandbox COO Sebastien Borget told Decrypt at this year’s NFC Lisbon that despite the high price point, Apple’s new VR headset is nonetheless “groundbreaking.” And though the tech giant never used the term “metaverse” in its reveal, Borget is sure that the technology will be key in growing participation in various digital worlds.

entry.title: Is Gala Safe? Gala Games Head of Blockchain on GALA, Crypto, and SEC Regulatory Turmoil
entry.summary: Gala Games President of Blockchain shares his thoughts on the GALA token upgrade and the latest SEC turmoil with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Artists Adopting NFTs Has Been ‘Really Market Dependent’, Says NFT Club Berlin’s Rebekka Revel
entry.summary: Getting non-crypto artists to make the leap into Web3 comes in ebbs and flows according to the market’s bear and bull waves, says co-founder of NFT Club Berlin and Superteam Germany Rebekka Revel. But she’s hoping to change that by changing the narrative around digital collectibles, regardless of the market, one word at a time.

entry.title: Big Brands Exploring Web3 to ‘Scale Up Their Super-fan Base’: Superduper Co-founder
entry.summary: Co-founder and co-CEO of Web3 media brand Superduper Dom Smith says big brands are eager to enter the space—they just don’t know how. Still, they all maintain a thesis of turning their communities into “super fans” that generate value for users as well as a firm’s bottom line.

entry.title: How 1 Simple Question Kickstarted Performance Artist Foodmasku's Plunge Into NFTs
entry.summary: As his food mask creations went viral on the Internet during the COVID lockdowns, reposted on TikTok and Instagram without his consent, he soon asked: "How do I protect my digital files?" Performance artist Foodmasku describes at this year's NFC Lisbon how that simple question spiraled into a minting collection after collection of his edible works.

entry.title: Arianee CEO Pegs Wine and Spirits as Next 'Exciting' Industry to Make Web3 Leap
entry.summary: CEO and co-founder of Arianee Pierre Nicolas Hurstel unpacks the wide spectrum of digital collectibles from 10,000 PFP collections to access passes for exclusive events. And with an unannounced big brand soon joining, Hurstel revealed at NFC Lisbon which kind of NFTs big brands are moving towards.
